text:
Reece Mastin (born 24 November 1994) is an English-born Australian singer and songwriter. He won the third season of "The X Factor Australia" in 2011. Mastin then signed with Sony Music Australia. His first single, "Good Night", reached number one in Australia and New Zealand. The song also became Sony Music Australia's fastest selling digital single. Mastin's three studio albums are "Reece Mastin", "Beautiful Nightmare" and "Change Colours".
Mastin was born in Scunthorpe, Lincolnshire. At the age of 11, he moved with his family to Greenwith, a suburb of Adelaide, South Australia.
